summary:
riahchan
 replied to your post  “Question 
Who do you ship Sansa with?
I'm almost finishing the seventh...”
                    ...
body:
riahchan replied to your post “Question Who do you ship Sansa with? I’m almost finishing the seventh…”
Jon… they are cousins but their interactions from season 6 and 7 are so tender and not sibling like.
http://athimbleful.tumblr.com/post/181613429125/jonsa-fic-recs-2 here’s a list of some canon-verse fics that are very good
http://athimbleful.tumblr.com/post/175472962980/jonsa-fic-recs

ok, this is super new for me… i never thought about it, BUT, I am interested. They are some of my favourite characters, and really, I have the picture of their reunion as my mobile wallpaper. I cried.

So, thank you so much!!!! I’ll check out all the fic recs!!!!!

summary: Sansa, Arya, and the Sigil of House Tarth
title: Sansa, Arya, and the Sigil of House Tarth
body:
I had a realization with regards to the sigil of House Tarth whilst rereading AGOT. When talking to Arya about her and Sansa, Ned says this:

You may be as different as the sun and the moon, but the same blood flows through both your hearts.
- AGoT, Arya II

The sigil of House Tarth is described like this:

The arms of Tarth were quartered rose and azure, and bore a yellow sun and crescent moon.
- AFFC, Brienne II

Brienne of Tarth’s story is very connected to the Stark girls. In ASOS, Brienne of Tarth is charged with bringing Jaime Lannister to King’s Landing by Catelyn Stark to make a hostage exchange for Sansa and Arya Stark. Later in AFFC, Brienne is on a quest to find Sansa Stark at the behest of Jaime Lannister and to uphold her vow to Catelyn Stark.

Brienne also shares some similarities to the Stark girls. Like Arya, Brienne does not fit the traditional mold of what a woman should be in the eyes of a patriarchal society like Westeros. Similarly to Sansa, Brienne is an idealistic young woman who held songs and the tales of true knights close to her heart.

summary: “And how should I be smarter, by listening to you?” is the most fuckboi thing Jonathan Snowflake has ever said. Yes Jonathan,...
body: “And how should I be smarter, by listening to you?” is the most fuckboi thing Jonathan Snowflake has ever said. Yes Jonathan, you should listen to your sister who has insight on all enemies except the Night King of course. It was that kind of thinking that almost got him killed (again) during BOTB.

summary: Jonsa is one of the most creative fandom ever. We all have great hope for our ship (and for Jaime and Brienne, strange to note...
body:
Jonsa is one of the most creative fandom ever.

We all have great hope for our ship (and for Jaime and Brienne, strange to note these two ships are bound in our hearts) even I dont know where we go in S8.

But I read so many beautiful fics, metas, quick thought, saw so many stunning arts, I will be always grateful for that.

The Journey isn’t over yet and my hope for Jonsa is more alive than ever.

Jon Snow and Sansa Stark have had, have, will have one of the most beautiful, respectful and honest love story in fandoms history and pray the lords Got Writers know the truth and see the Light.

But thank you guys. Thank you.

The Royal Couple is eternelly grateful to our contribution.

summary: Yes, Sansa wants love just like us
title: Yes, Sansa wants love just like us
body:
Today on twitter I sent this tweet:

PSA: Just because someone has suffered trauma esp. sexual or physical abuse, it doesn’t mean they don’t want love or intimacy or marriage or a future family. It could mean that they crave it even more. #TeamSansa #SansaStark

The tweet was in response to an answer I received on a Quora question. The question was about Sansa’s would-be wedding or coronation dress. A highly speculative question that I tossed up for fun. Because who doesn’t like to speculate about what Sansa’s dresses might look like. There were some great answers and not so great ones as is often the case with Quora. You can read the question and answers HERE.

Of course, at least one person answered with the very tired idea of Sansa not wanting to get married because of everything she went through. My tweet was a much more diplomatic version of the thought that went through my head. ‘F-U just because a woman has been assaulted doesn’t mean she doesn’t want love. They literally have Littlefinger ask her ‘What do you want that you do not have?” Answer” ‘Love’ you motherf*ckers.’ 

When did being assaulted, sexually or physically, become an impediment to wanting to find love or intimacy or marriage or family? For the record, Daenerys was also assaulted by her husband. And she seemed to be up for intimacy later on just fine. No one is saying Daenerys wouldn’t want to marry anyone. But I digress, I’m not here to stoke the flames of the Sansa v’s Daenerys conversation. 

It might take a little more time and trust and a decent person. It is something that many want not in spite of their history with trauma but because of it. Casual dating or hooking up can feel scary to someone dealing with trauma. The idea of a trustworthy caring partner that can feel like a relief. 

The song that plays when Sansa brings the Knights of the Vale to the BoTB is called ‘Trust Each Other’. This is a sweeping epic track. Yet, the title refers to an act often more intimate, trust. Something Jon and Sansa need to do. They both need this. Sansa because of her abuse and Jon because he was betrayed by his own men. That’s some heavy sh*t. 

Will Jon be the man that Sansa trusts enough to be intimate with? We can’t say that for sure. I, of course, believe there is very strong evidence to suggest that he will. Trust is a running theme throughout their relationship. We see them grapple with asking for it, giving it, believing they have it from the other person.

Regardless of who the man she may marry is, Sansa’s arc has long been tied to marriage and family. The pay off is not Sansa being alone. The pay off is Sansa finding that through it all she is in a place where she is able to choose for herself. 

Let’s talk about how Sansa’s costumes might help tell this story. 

The show by costuming Sansa very tightly wrapped in season 7 and presumably again in season 8. with actual leather armor, Is trying to convey the idea that Sansa is protecting herself. No one is going to get in. No one is going to hurt her. I find it odd that this theme didn’t come into play in the second half of season 6…but then there were different costume designers. Her look in season 6 was about reclaiming her Stark identity.  She spent most of the show trying to dress in Southron manner or as the Lady of Eyrie or in disguise when she traveled with Littlefinger. In season 5, we saw hints of Lyanna and Catelyn’s looks in her costumes. It wasn’t obvious and it didn’t last long. And well once she married Ramsey we saw her hooded in grey, the girl in grey, a shadow or a ghost in Winterfell. The payoff for all this was Sansa finally wearing the ‘wolf bit’. Finally declaring her Starkness.

Well, some viewers might see the tightly wrapped and bound Sansa of season 7 to be indicative of how she will end her journey. They may think that in the end she will stay wrapped in her own version of armor not letting anyone in. But I ask, where is the pay off in that? There is none. There is no growth, no change. And what a heartwrenching ending for a character so tied to romance. 

The ties will be unbound, in her own time on her own terms and with the person of her choosing. The suffering and loss will never go away. There is bound to be more. That is the bittersweet part of the story. All this needless suffering. We weep for a girl who never should’ve had to wrap herself in leather belts to feel safe in the first place. It’s the same way we weep for ourselves. For the girls, we used to be. The girls we were before assaults and abuse marked us.  For Sansa, the armor will come off. It must. Because that is a dream of spring. Because why else have we been watching this ‘d*mn’ show.

Will Jon be the man that Sansa trusts enough to be intimate with? We can’t say that for sure. I, of course, believe there is very strong evidence to suggest that he will. Trust is a running theme throughout their relationship. We see them grapple with asking for it, giving it, believing they have it from the other person.

Regardless of who the man she may marry is, Sansa’s arc has long been tied to marriage and family. The pay off is not Sansa being alone. The pay off is Sansa finding that through it all she is in a place where she is able to choose for herself. 

Let’s talk about how Sansa’s costumes might help tell this story. 

The show by costuming Sansa very tightly wrapped in season 7 and presumably again in season 8. with actual leather armor, Is trying to convey the idea that Sansa is protecting herself. No one is going to get in. No one is going to hurt her. I find it odd that this theme didn’t come into play in the second half of season 6…but then there were different costume designers. Her look in season 6 was about reclaiming her Stark identity.  She spent most of the show trying to dress in Southron manner or as the Lady of Eyrie or in disguise when she traveled with Littlefinger. In season 5, we saw hints of Lyanna and Catelyn’s looks in her costumes. It wasn’t obvious and it didn’t last long. And well once she married Ramsey we saw her hooded in grey, the girl in grey, a shadow or a ghost in Winterfell. The payoff for all this was Sansa finally wearing the ‘wolf bit’. Finally declaring her Starkness.

Well, some viewers might see the tightly wrapped and bound Sansa of season 7 to be indicative of how she will end her journey. They may think that in the end she will stay wrapped in her own version of armor not letting anyone in. But I ask, where is the pay off in that? There is none. There is no growth, no change. And what a heartwrenching ending for a character so tied to romance. 

The ties will be unbound, in her own time on her own terms and with the person of her choosing. The suffering and loss will never go away. There is bound to be more. That is the bittersweet part of the story. All this needless suffering. We weep for a girl who never should’ve had to wrap herself in leather belts to feel safe in the first place. It’s the same way we weep for ourselves. For the girls, we used to be. The girls we were before assaults and abuse marked us.  For Sansa, the armor will come off. It must. Because that is a dream of spring. Because why else have we been watching this ‘d*mn’ show.
trail.content:
Today on twitter I sent this tweet:

PSA: Just because someone has suffered trauma esp. sexual or physical abuse, it doesn’t mean they don’t want love or intimacy or marriage or a future family. It could mean that they crave it even more. #TeamSansa #SansaStark

The tweet was in response to an answer I received on a Quora question. The question was about Sansa’s would-be wedding or coronation dress. A highly speculative question that I tossed up for fun. Because who doesn’t like to speculate about what Sansa’s dresses might look like. There were some great answers and not so great ones as is often the case with Quora. You can read the question and answers HERE.

Of course, at least one person answered with the very tired idea of Sansa not wanting to get married because of everything she went through. My tweet was a much more diplomatic version of the thought that went through my head. ‘F-U just because a woman has been assaulted doesn’t mean she doesn’t want love. They literally have Littlefinger ask her ‘What do you want that you do not have?” Answer” ‘Love’ you motherf*ckers.’ 

When did being assaulted, sexually or physically, become an impediment to wanting to find love or intimacy or marriage or family? For the record, Daenerys was also assaulted by her husband. And she seemed to be up for intimacy later on just fine. No one is saying Daenerys wouldn’t want to marry anyone. But I digress, I’m not here to stoke the flames of the Sansa v’s Daenerys conversation. 

It might take a little more time and trust and a decent person. It is something that many want not in spite of their history with trauma but because of it. Casual dating or hooking up can feel scary to someone dealing with trauma. The idea of a trustworthy caring partner that can feel like a relief. 

The song that plays when Sansa brings the Knights of the Vale to the BoTB is called ‘Trust Each Other’. This is a sweeping epic track. Yet, the title refers to an act often more intimate, trust. Something Jon and Sansa need to do. They both need this. Sansa because of her abuse and Jon because he was betrayed by his own men. That’s some heavy sh*t. 

Will Jon be the man that Sansa trusts enough to be intimate with? We can’t say that for sure. I, of course, believe there is very strong evidence to suggest that he will. Trust is a running theme throughout their relationship. We see them grapple with asking for it, giving it, believing they have it from the other person.

Regardless of who the man she may marry is, Sansa’s arc has long been tied to marriage and family. The pay off is not Sansa being alone. The pay off is Sansa finding that through it all she is in a place where she is able to choose for herself. 

Let’s talk about how Sansa’s costumes might help tell this story. 

The show by costuming Sansa very tightly wrapped in season 7 and presumably again in season 8. with actual leather armor, Is trying to convey the idea that Sansa is protecting herself. No one is going to get in. No one is going to hurt her. I find it odd that this theme didn’t come into play in the second half of season 6…but then there were different costume designers. Her look in season 6 was about reclaiming her Stark identity.  She spent most of the show trying to dress in Southron manner or as the Lady of Eyrie or in disguise when she traveled with Littlefinger. In season 5, we saw hints of Lyanna and Catelyn’s looks in her costumes. It wasn’t obvious and it didn’t last long. And well once she married Ramsey we saw her hooded in grey, the girl in grey, a shadow or a ghost in Winterfell. The payoff for all this was Sansa finally wearing the ‘wolf bit’. Finally declaring her Starkness.

Well, some viewers might see the tightly wrapped and bound Sansa of season 7 to be indicative of how she will end her journey. They may think that in the end she will stay wrapped in her own version of armor not letting anyone in. But I ask, where is the pay off in that? There is none. There is no growth, no change. And what a heartwrenching ending for a character so tied to romance. 

The ties will be unbound, in her own time on her own terms and with the person of her choosing. The suffering and loss will never go away. There is bound to be more. That is the bittersweet part of the story. All this needless suffering. We weep for a girl who never should’ve had to wrap herself in leather belts to feel safe in the first place. It’s the same way we weep for ourselves. For the girls, we used to be. The girls we were before assaults and abuse marked us.  For Sansa, the armor will come off. It must. Because that is a dream of spring. Because why else have we been watching this ‘d*mn’ show.

blog.name: fedonciadale
blog.title: FedonCiadale
blog.description: Fantasy aficionado since I read Tolkien in my teenage years. I still love Tolkien but I am also into other works. I love ASOIAF (books) and GoT (Show). I also like Brandon Sanderson, Lois McMaster Bujold, in short in my free time it's fantasy...Header by courtesy of ragekitn!

title: To go south - chapter 38 - Preparations
body:
So, another chapter of my long, long fic…. Sansa wants some advice from Bran on how to negotiate. But Bran is planning, also on AO3. Next chapter is ready and will be up tomorrow!

“Why did you send Jon away, if you knew Daenerys was coming?”, Sansa asked her brother. She could hear the stress in her voice, that came from reigning herself in, so that she would not shout at her brother.

Bran at first said no word. The leaves of the weirwood branch threw shadows on Bran’s face. He focussed on the sky just left of Sansa’s face so intensely that Sansa was tempted to turn around to check if Daenerys’ dragon had taken so the sky. But there was nothing to see. It was a sunny day, if cold, and the sky was spotless.

“If Jon were here, it would have come to a fight.”, Bran answered finally. “I thought that would be obvious.”

Sansa threw her hands in the air.

“Honestly, Bran,” she said. “I wish you would share more of what you want and what you plan.”

Bran gave her a smile, one of his new smiles that looked as if he just remembered how to move the muscles in his face, and nothing more.

“I’m so sorry, Sansa. The future is a shifting river. A small thing I tell you might cause a maelstrom that carries us all to our death.”

He gazed at his lap. Sansa glanced at her brother, but he did not carry on.

“I suggested negotiations on a whim,” she finally said. “I just wanted to buy time. What do I even have to offer her? Apart from not blowing her up.” She sighed. “She must know that I cannot possibly carry through with this threat. We would destroy Winterfell.”

Bran looked up again. “You insist that I tell you something?”

Sansa looked at him, and exasperation crept into her voice. “Bran, you are a seer, I could use some counsel.”

Bran was silent for such a long time, that Sansa contemplated turning on her heels.

“Tell her, I’ll give her a glimpse into the future, if she renews her promise to fight against the Walkers.”

“And that will make her come around?”

Bran shrugged. “Maybe.”

A twinkle entered his eye. “If she wants a marriage alliance, tell her I’m available.”

Sansa laughed despite herself. “You don’t even know her.”

The twinkle left Bran’s eyes. “I saw enough.”

“So that is your counsel?”, Sansa asked.

“I don’t need to tell you to be careful, nor how to negotiate.”

“Will you tell me whom I should take with me?”

“Take Ser Jaime and Arya.”

“Will she not be angry if Jaime is with us?” she wanted to know.

“Jaime could bring Tyrion around, if he happens to mention that he has no ambition to get Casterly Rock any longer. And he is a better choice than Brienne.”

“Why Arya?”

“If anything goes wrong, she’ll be there to avenge you.”

“Did I ever tell you that you have become so comforting,” Sansa told him.

“Only a few things are comforting in these times.” Bran turned, his intent clearly on the weirwood.

“Now, if you excuse me. I have to plan.” His hand hovered near the trunk of the weirwood.

Sansa glanced at him, half annoyed and half worried. She turned to leave.

“One last thing,” Bran called after her.

“Do not under any circumstances mention your condition, but I guess you know that.”

Sansa felt the blood rising to her face.

“I’m not even sure yet,” she whispered. “I just became suspicious this morning. My moon blood is only a few days late. Do you see everything?”

Bran shrugged. “I don’t linger on unimportant things. There are quite a lot of children in your future, that is, if we have a future. How you get them is none of my business.”

“Why did you send Jon away, if you knew Daenerys was coming?”, Sansa asked her brother. She could hear the stress in her voice, that came from reigning herself in, so that she would not shout at her brother.

blog.name: cleverjonquil
blog.title: As strong as my lady mother
blog.description: Side blog for all my Sansa/Catelyn/Elia love. Critical of show!Dany but still like book!Dany. Tully Loyalist. Pro Northern Independence. Book Jon >>> Show Jon. I track #courtesyismyarmor and #daughterofrivers

summary: I always considered Dany's dragons to be her armor, since they protect her from harm. Their skin is like hard leather armor. But...
question: I always considered Dany's dragons to be her armor, since they protect her from harm. Their skin is like hard leather armor. But Sansa doesn't have that. And these WW are monsters with superhuman strength, who can toss you across the room with a single hit, whose touch alone can freeze your weapons, and as the NK showed, they may even be able to turn you into one of them even if you're alive (the offered baby). Though that could be NK only power, still. Sansa needs armor at the bare minimum.
answer:
But again, Sansa’s going to be inside where the women, children, elderly, and injured are, managing food and seeing that things in WF are running smoothly so things outside WF can run smoothly. There’s no reason at all for someone who hasn’t a clue how to fight to be outside where the fighting is. D&D have a bad reputation for disregarding feminine work, which is why many of us are side-eyeing this creative decision.

Plus, Visenya wore armor and she had a dragon. And D is not known for her careful planning. She impulsively flew off on Drogon in the books and got lost and sick, and on the show seems even more impulsive so personally I wouldn’t use her war choices as a comparison. 😛
